intro: Oreopanax urubambanus, commonly known as the Urubamba oreopanax, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments, often in cloud forests. Its stem is woody and can reach several meters in height, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
